title: Summarizing Google Summer of Code - 2022
text: It is already time for the final submission for this year’s GSoC where I was working with The R project of Statistical Computing for the last 3 months and this is the time I ponder over my accomplishments over the period.

title: Summarizing Google Summer of Code - 2022
text:
Background knowledge
As with the nature of the topic, I had to delve right into understanding Vedic calendar system1 and its various sub-parts as well. How sun’s and moon’s position changes month, year and how moon’s phase determines lunar months were the most important part.

title: Summarizing Google Summer of Code - 2022
text:
Package development

Initial development
With the basic understanding of the calendar system and with the help of other R libraries (Stubner et al. 2019), built a working version of R functions which can convert a Gregorian calendar date to an equivalent Vedic calendar component.


Re-factoring
After the initial development of basic functions, a significant time went into re-factoring and debugging the existing codebase.

title: Summarizing Google Summer of Code - 2022
text:
Preparation for CRAN

Unit-testing
Since from the start, the intention was to publish the package to CRAN as there remains to package in R to handle Vedic calendar system. In that regard, based on the GSoC proposal, almost 70% test coverage were achieved.


Documentation

Function Description
All of the library functions were documented with roxygen2 .


Vignettes
Vignettes and supporting documentations were added to make the library much more useful and understandable.

Associated PR

title: Summarizing Google Summer of Code - 2022
text:
Publishing to CRAN

Testing with rhub
In order to publish to CRAN with minimal NOTES or WARNINGS, thorough testing on 3 different platforms [ubuntu-gcc-release, windows-x86_64-release, macos-m1-bigsur-release ] were performed and the result were added.

Associated PR￼￼
cran-comments.md

VedicDateTime-v0.1.1

title: Summarizing Google Summer of Code - 2022
section: A comparative analysis of calendar seasonality
text:
A comparative analysis of calendar seasonality
As the primary intention of the project was to understand calender seasonality between solar and luni-solar calendar systems, I conducted a comparative analysis taking into account the earlier analysis performed (Bokde 2021) to understand any correlation, if any. Details of the study can be found in the attached Github repository.

Understanding Effects of calendar System
